page.title: 10The sand dunes (2)
page.content:
There are a number of archaeological monuments found scattered across the lowere dunes. Notably there are several{menhirs}(standing stones) of probably late Neolithic/Bronze age date. There is also a small burial chamber (now filled in) which had many bones it it, hence its name {The {Ossuary.} Scattered archaeological finds are common.
The sand beneath the dunes is thick enough in this southern part of the bay to make a{natural water reservoir. The waterworks company pump some water from these sands using well landscaped pumps. A scheme has been put forward to impound all the water in the sand using a clay screen just inside the line of the sea wall. The amount of water available is argued about.
